text: UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Tap at the source. Pours hazy yellow, white head. Aroma is lots of mango, orange, tangerine, big dankness, pineapple, so juicy. So good. Flavor is orange juice, tangerine, mango, pineapple, very dank, little bit of booze, orange rind. Juicy, fresh fruit. Bit if burn, but very full bodied. Amazing.

16 oz can. Pours a very hazy golden orange color and capped by a small off white layer of foam that settles into thin film. The aroma is really nice and shows notes of very juicy orange, tangerine, pineapple, and peach with a soft biscuit malt base and hints of citrus and grassy hops. The flavor follows and is very juicy with huge waves of orange, tangerine, and pineapple citrus fruit to go with the soft biscuit and caramel malts. Pillowy mouthfeel with soft bitterness on the back end. Just a beautiful bouquet of citrus and tropical fruit juices. Medium bodied and very smooth with soft carbonation that leads to a juicy citrus finish with very little lingering bitterness. Just really well executed as this drinks more like a single than a double ipa. Really tasty stuff here. Awesome beer. I hope to get more of this.
Pour from can. Cloudy yellow color. Juicy and fruity. Lemon, grassy hops. Light bitterness. Flavorful but refreshing.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 Pours a very, very hazy pale yellow with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of juicy fruits, dank onions and booze. Taste is of oranges with a moderately high bitterness. Moderately sweet. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. Lightly juicy. Some alcohol is felt. Overall a pretty solid IIPA by Bissel Brothers, Ill certainly pick up a few packs next time Im over there!
16 ounce can. Pours a hazy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and grass. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, orange, mango, grass, and some malt. Excellent.

On tap at a Churchkey event, pours a hazy, neon yellow with some lacing, white head. Punchy nose, chives, lemon, perfume, soap, grass. FLavor is nice, lemon, parmesan rind, soap, grass, chive, a little tropical fruit sweetness. Finishes a little oily.

can shared by jimbo, thanks man! pours cloudy glowing yellow with a creamy white cap offering some retention and lacing. pungent fragrant onions and garlic, catpee, loads of tropical fruits, fruit juiciness, white grape grappa-like warming alcohol, very clean fruity american yeast action. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; smooth and balanced tropical-citrusy finish. awesome juice.

Can (473 ml), shared at tasting. Thanks to Jean-Michaël for this one! Hazy green-ish golden with a small-medium white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is super dank and weed forward with soft fun resin, Taste is dank and weed forward with resin, tropical notes and light resinous notes. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Dank finish. Great dank forward IIPA. Super easy drinking, dangerous.

500ml can. Very pale hazy amber. Nose big floral notes. Fruity. Punchy. Taste floral and juicy. Big fruity and floral. Finish floral and bitter juicy hops. Quite sharp. Wow awesome stuff. Not gentle. World class.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2017 Juice for days, creamy body, some decent bitterness. This has everything. I could drink this all day everyday.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Very earthy funky sweaty aromas. Yellow pale haze white head. Nice soft juices that hits in the back of your mouth and flavors to the front. Soft body. Nice stand out in the style.
Draft. Small white head atop murky apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, dank, grapefruit, some pineapple. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, pineapple, some dank. Medium body

Pours a very hazy, muddy yellow-brown, with almost no head (it really doesnt look too appetizing). Aroma is very dank, with loads of citrus and big hop presence. Flavor is intensely bitter, with a huge citrus element (grapefruit) and a lot of pine-hop bite. Very smooth, luscious, pillowy mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Really nice.
16oz can sampled at Dans. Poured a cloudy yellow color with a small foamy white head. Aroma/taste of citrus hops, tropical fruit, armpits, grass, bready malts, and onions. Dank and solid!

Can shared at Dans. Poured a softer yellow body under an average sized foamy head. Aroma of broccoli and cream soup, toast. Flavor is far different and much better than the aroma, fruity, grassy hops, fresh bread and a hint of broccoli on the end for some reason. Medium mouthfeel with average carbonation. Solid but the Extra Kreme was far better.
Murky straw colored pour at the brewery. Aroma is pineapple, grain, and orange zest. Mouthfeel is creamy and supple. Tropical, zesty, and rich. Delicious, fresh Double IPA.
Can, thanks JC. Loads of grapefruit. Taste is good. Loads of tropical fruit, juicy, lots of hops. Great stuff! Booze is hidden. Impressive stuff.

Tasted from can. Pours a super murky pale yellow with thick white head. Aroma is citrusy with lots of lemon some tropical fruits and grassy aromas. Super well balanced taste. Passionfruit, pineapple, lemon, melon, biscuits, caramel. Awesome IPA that doesn't get much better than this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Super bright and citrus forward IIPA. Bright orange-yellow color. So very crushable for a double, or a single IPA for that matter. Not as complex as the Pride & Purpose, but just as delicious. Lots of pineapple, citrus rind and even lemon lime. Good stuff.

Hazy pale white amber color. Very dank biscuity, citrusy nose. Tastes like white grapefruit juice with some biscuit character. Doesnt come across as beer. Light medium bodySo flawlessly executed smooth and modest bitterness. The abv is so well hidden. Just perfectly executed. So quaffable. Just amazing.

Pours hazy pear into a shaker. Bright white soapy head with little retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Dusty scallion and tropical fruit aromas. Sharp with yeasty scallion and hot passionfruit upfront turning to bitter pith in the dry, lasting finish. Obviously, I wanted to like this one more...

Can picked up at the brewery. Pours a very hazy yellow. Aroma is very tropical, I get mostly pineapple, mango, citrus, and a little bubblegum. Really good carbonation. Taste follows the smell precisely, a real juice bomb. Tastes even better as it warms. Barely any malt presence. Overall, this is in my top 10 beers of all time and for me as perfect as a NE IIPA can get.

Can from Tristan. Pours a pale yellow and super milky hazy. Huge tropical fruit hop nose with a hint of green pepper. Super smooth malt, orange juice sweetness that segues into a grassy pepper bitterness in the taste. Damn good brew.

Can at home. A hazy and golden beauty with a very small white head. Aroma is very tropical, taste is tropical fruits, both pineapple, mango and guava, citrus with orange and a hint of grapefruit. Love it!!
Super milky. Pineapple. Kinda sweet. Mango bomb. Orange.  Looks like milky urine (dont ask). Delicious! Thx Patrick!

16oz can thanks to Mike. Pours out a hazy cloudy gold topped with a white head. Nose is tropical fruit notes orange juice hops and some sweetness. Taste is more of the nice tropical fruits citrus sweetness.
So far one of my favorite NE beers! Try it out, for a reguler you dont get much better than this

Can thanks to MarkusTH. Thanks! Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of fresh juicy fuckin hops, passionfruit, orange, pineapple, grassy hops. Taste has a lot of pineapple, dank hops, orange, mandarin, grassy bitter finish.

Shared at Samm Fest II. Poured hazy golden with white head that laced well. Nose was melon, pineapple, hops, florals. Smooth flavor, mango, honeydew, pineapple, grapefruit, floral perfumy notes, and that smooth finish. Wonderful.
Hazy murky golden pour, good sized head, thick ring of lace. Dank aroma and taste, weed, peach, mango, subtle malt sweetness. Excellent.

To me this is very similar to the Pow Pow I had at Christmas. If you missed out on that try this. Similar in color and aroma. Maybe a little more bitter on the back end. Also maybe a little more carbonated, although had this in a can and Pow in a growler.

16oz can shared with Sam and Julien. Pours golden yellow, super hazy, great foamy head leaving a great lacing. Smells of strong citrus, grapefruit, sweet honey, mango and the slight smoothness of hops at the end. Taste is great bitterness, absolute citrus fruit bomb with a nice subtle earthiness at the end.Great, great mouthfeel. Full and very smooth. delicious.
In draft at the brewery it is a cloudy yellow gold with a thick off white head. The aroma is one apple and the taste is strong bitter orange that has a smooth pineapple finish
In draft at the brewery. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a thick off white head. Aroma of ever ripe tropical fruits. Flavors of orange and pine. Tasty.

Fresh can into a snifter showing hazy mucous yellow with no head. 

The nose shows big dank notes of cannabis and light pine resin. 

The palate is light bodied and lightly carbonated. Strong flavors of cannabis and pine with a moderate but gentle bitterness. Strong citric zest spiciness on the finish. I understand its insanely hyped, but I definitely prefer Substance.

Cloudy bright orange body, fluffy white head, and dense soapy lacing. A big blend of pineapple and grapefruit with some tangerine and mango backing things up. Medium bodied, semi-dry body, smooth, light carbonation, juicy throughout. Delicious.

Tasted on 11/10/16 from a 16oz can purchased at the brewery for the first release this year. Pours cloudy, very bright orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to average lace. The nose is tremendously complex with everything from grapefruit and orange peel, pineapple juice, mango, guava, pitted fruit, gooseberry, white grapes, a nice bit of earthy yeast, and a hint of some bread malt. The flavor is orange juice, mango puree, pineapple juice, guava, gooseberry and white grape acidity, very faint grapefruit peel bitterness, along with the same very faint hints of bread malt and earthy yeast. The body is medium plus, nearly full, with plenty of texture and acidity, average carbonation, and a long complex fruity, hint of bitter and earthy finish.

Pours orangish hazy yellow with thin head. Smell is tropical fruit juice, hops, mango and grapefruit. Taste is mango, hops, tropical fruit and orange. Super juicy and smooth mouth feel. Medium body light carb.

On tap at the brewery. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Fruit hop bouquet. Citrus hop notes dominate with bitter grapefruit and mellow pine resin backbeats. Mango and pineapple undercurrents. Strong caramel malt presence to keep the hops in check. Above average body and mouthfeel.

21/V/16 - 1Pt can @ Erwins Ponton Tasting - BB: n/a (2016-605) Thanks to Amy for the can!
Cloudy beige blond beer, small irregular off-white head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of tropical fruits, pineapple, passion fruit, lovely smell! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very hoppy, bitter, citrus, lots of grapefruit, tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus. Aftertaste: resinous, bit sweet, malty, lots of tropical fruits, very hoppy. What a lovely beer!
16 ounce can from Timfoolery, cloudy, thin head, lots of grapefruit, medium bitter.
Unfiltered golden color. Beautiful pibeapple and mango aromas. Flavor is much the same with a touch of bitterness on the finish. Really solid world class IPA.

Can - Hazy golden pour with a foamy white head. Nose is tangerine and onion with with notes of mango and a dry, biscuity malt base. Taste is a bit of a letdown--the citrus is still there, but theres a lot of astringent bitterness. Finishes like a headache. Thick and slick. I get the 100 rating on this one, but it just feels okay to me.

Big can, and on draft at the brewery. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of strong fruity and citrusy hops, pale malts, and dough. Flavor the same with a lot of fresh tropical and citrusy hops. Average texture. A very good IPA.

CAN - Can. Milky. Hazy orange. Huge grapefruit bomb in aroma. Mouthfeel is pretty basic. Thin, fleeting and watery. On the "swish" its orange peel and tangerines and a little sucrose. Has a nice bitterness that fades fast (why are all of these IPAs so thick like a milkshake? its gross)

Can from the brewery, packaged on 4/15/16. Poured into a pint glass a thick cloudy yellow, looks like pineapple/orange juice. Strong citrus aroma, grassy notes. Tropical fruit up front and floral pop on the back end. Fruit and grass dominate. Nice, long botanic hop finish. Fantastic.

Draught at the brewery, 4/2/16.This batch was just canned and released this weekend, lucky me! A heavily hazy, nearly soupy amber-golden body topped by a medium-sized white head that fades quickly to cover.Juice, juicy fruit sweetness and...well....more juice and tropical fruits. Ya, this is not screaming complexity, but the mango-papaya-cherry-pineapple is about as good as yourre going to find. No edge to it whatsoever and only sweet honey-like base malts hang in the background. No booze or flaw.In the flavor its incredibly soft, malty and gently sweet while still maintaining good attenuation. Just a phenomenally tropical juice bomb with moderate cherry character as well. Low but ultra-tight carbonation and low bitterness with no resin or pine. No booze here and no flaw. Just massively juicy hop notes, soft, creamy-malty carbonation-texture and just a nip of bitterness to balance. Pretty f-in good.

Can from thepatrickman-thanks! Pours cloudy straw yellow orange. Nose is big citrus and tropical hops, some pine. Taste is dry with flavor of juicy tropical and citrus fruits, minerality from some yeast, and grapefruit pith on finish.

Appearance- cloudy dark straw color
Aroma- grapefruity, hoppy but not over-powering very mellow
Taste- grape fruity strong hop presence slightly bitter but well balanced finish
Overall- very good more grapefruity and slightly less bitter than heady topper

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can thanks to Andrew. Pours a turbid yellow with medium creamy white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is tropical fruit, tangerine and mango, dank hops. Thick mouth, juicy hop, mango, light bitterness, very nice.
Tap at Bissell Brothers Brewing Company, Portland. Originally rated 20160220. Colour is very cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, hops and malts.

Poured from a can. 
Aroma is nice with some medium light cracker malt notes. A lot of hop character with grapefruit and tropical fruit leading the way followed by dank notes with some onion character. Some light resin notes as well as stone fruit. 
Pours a murky, pale, golden straw color with a moderately tall, medium thick, white head that exhibits nice retention as it recedes to a thin film that lingers. Moderate lacing with small legs. 
Flavor has a semi light sweetness with medium cracker malt notes that initially linger in the finish. Medium high bitterness that also lingers. Moderately strong hop flavors with nice tropical fruit and citrus notes. Less grapefruit and dank, onion, notes than in the aroma, but they are still present and balance out the tropical fruit. Some lingering sweet tropical fruit notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very nice NE IPA with more hop character than Substance Ale. I also like the hop profile more and enjoy the differences in character of the aroma and flavor.

A great example of the hoppy, fruity, cloudy New England DIPAs that are coming out recently. The nose and aroma are huge waves of orange, melon, and tropical fruit, and it is up there as one of the hazier beers Ive ever seen. The taste is hop fruitiness to begin with, but it kind of falls away at the end. Theres no bitterness at all (which I like for this style) but it finishes more watery than hoppy. Overall -- an extremely good DIPA.

Poured a hazy orange color with a white head. Aroma was very orangey, light tropical, but very bright. Flavor similar, juicy or ages and peaches, falls off a little bit on the end, but overall pretty good.
A real Dank Beer. everything I am looking for in a beer. Pours light and cloudy, aroma is amazing as well as taste

16 oz. can. Very hazy pale orange. Distinctive Bissell Brothers aroma. Nice citrus hop aroma. Grainy malt profile. Bright orange hops. Light sweetness. Distinctive Bissell yeast. Mineral and grainy finish. A little astringent and boozy. Very good, though.
One of my favorite IPAs. Hazy orange appearance. Nice melon and orange flavors balanced with a soft bitter finish. Great mouthfeel on this as well.
Can from a trade. Pours a hazy glowing orange with a white head. Aromas of tangerine, light melon, peach. Taste is medium light bitterness with a slightly sweet softer finish. Another great NE IPA.
Can shared thanks to Art. Poured cloudy yellow orange with min white head. Aroma fruity tropical citrus OJ. Light carb med bod. Taste bittersweet OJ pulp
16oz can pours a hazy dirty yellow amber color with a bit of head. Passionfruit aroma pops out of the can. Passionfruit and tropical fruit flavors.
Can at James 10k tasting. Pours a faintly hazed gold with a thin white head. Musk, dank citrus. Medium bodied, dank and musky, citrus and a touch of sweet malt. Long musk and citrus into the finish.

Tasting at Bjorn and Sannes place. Thanks for sharing the beers!
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, nice.
TASTE: rather sweet, some pine, hoppy.
Can brought by BBQSlim, thanks! Pineapple, very sweet, citrus, nice bitterness. Awesome beer.
Can at 10K. Pours gold white head. nose/taste of pineapple, cracker malt, citrus and pine. medium body. Dank.
Can. Yellow our with white head. Herbal and grassy, some citrus aromas. Similarly fresh hop tones, herbal, citrus and grassy.

Can thanks to JBPortland! Pours crystal clear golden, small white head, dissipates fairly slowly, good lacing. Aroma is tropical, guava, mango, dank, and some pot. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, juicy, dank, fruity, some grainy malt. Medium light body. Solid effort.

Pint can into a BBB tasting glass I got at the brewery. Pours a hazy sun kissed yellow/ hay, golden grain suppletion. Aroma of dank hops, then a citrus overtone followed by a malt push. Picked up at the brewery on the 2/21/15 release. Hoppy prevalations succeed, then theres a modest yet pushy malt profile that brings down the juicy hops. A liberator perhaps? Citrus canopy delivers the rest. Taste of giant hops, citrus melody, fun drinking east coast beast of a dipa. Fun place to visit. Maine beer at its best.

Roughly week-old can poured into HF glass. Pours a very pale hazy straw color, small head, small ring of lacing. Aroma is super juicy and tropical, and very dank, too: mango and lychee lead the way followed by sweet orange, cantaloupe, honey, candied lemon, white grape, fresh-cut grass, flowers, resin. Taste is extremely fruity as well but with some alcohol apparent and aggressive pine and resin, though only moderate bitterness: piney sweet orange and candied grapefruit along with mango, piña colada, and a super resinous/dank/herbal finish. Bitterness builds to an aggressive level with more sips. Definitely a notch above most beers in its category, though the booze and bitterness make it less refined than the best of the Northeast. Still, a solid offering  Heady lovers, take note.

Thanks Blue_rogue. 
This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a glazed over yellow/slight orange color. The head dissipated immediately. Light lacing stuck only around the glass. 
The smell had a wonderful sweet to lightly spiced combination of raw piney and grapefruit. Adequately enthralled with the substance of the bitter sweet citrus hops, a light burst of sweet onion runs into the aroma and blends wonderfully. 
The taste took all of those previously mentioned flavors and amplifies to flavor. Theres no aftertaste nor finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation hits like a good DIPA should but still isnt overbearing. A lingering semi - soft bitter dryness rolls over my tongue. 
Overall, I say this was a very good DIPA that I would love to have again.
Yellow/orange pour, white head. Lots of citrusy hops up front, the malt bill is subdued. This is a very vibrant beer. Some grassy flavors. Really a nice brew.

Can thanks to WillRunForBeer. Cloudy light orange pour with a small head that quickly fades to a thin ring. Wow, nice aroma. Reminds of heady a bit. Dank but juicy. Pineapple, fresh cut grass, juicy oranges, dank oily hops and light mango. Tastes so good too. Juicy without being so sweet. Nice moderate bitter bite in the finish. Packed with citrus and tropical fruit. Fresh dank hops. Medium body. Oily mouthfeel. This is incredible. Seriously, why are all the best hoppy beers coming from the northeast. I would buy this in bulk for the summer. Thanks Brian!
Golden color with wispy white head. Aroma is cat pee to the extreme with pine grass and tropical fruits. Taste is sweet juicy and cat pee. Too much simcoe but otherwise tasty.

Can thanks to Kyle! Pours a hazy mellow yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of pine with some resin, a bit of grapefruit and an earthy grain backbone. Flavor has lots of pine as well with a good amount of resin, some grapefruit and a light grain backbone.

Pours a light pilsnery yellow with almost no head. Nose is not as big as I would like, but is nice and fruity. The taste is supremely balanced, no over the top hop bitterness, nice honeydew mellon flavor. Great beer, could only be improved by a better nose.
Can. Pours cloudy golden with not much head or lacing. Nose is big tropical dankness. Taste adds some orange sweetness. Nice.

Pours a rich golden color with a finger of foam. Nose is a typical DIPA onslaught of dank hops, tropical fruit, some sweet caramel backbone and some forest frolicking through the pine and spruce trees. Palate follows with big punchy hop notes, nice mouthfeel and dialed in carbonation levels. Sweet backbone helps balance the juicy hop notes but the booze does get a touch volatile in the late lingering bitterness. Solid DIPA.

Northeast Bucket List Trip Beer #90. Keg at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange with a thin creamy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of resin, pine, tropical hops and raw malt. The taste is tropical, resin, pine hops and pale malt. Medium bodied, strong lingering bitterness.
Poured from can thanks Willrunforbeer. Color is hazy yellow with a fading white head. Aromas of fresh citrus and dankness. Taste is crisp with grapefruit and peach tones. A nice drinking IPA!
Can, thanks Kristen & Pat!!!. Right up there with the best ive had. Pine, grapefruit, mango fruit forward hops. Greatmouthfeel, incredible flavor. SEEK THISOUT

Can from Joe. Had this right after The Substance. Here we go. Poured to my Rapp Brewing tulip. Pours hazy deep yellow with a half finger of creamy white head. Aroma of pineapple and mango, deer honey, some pine, lots if citrus fruits and sweet pineapple. Mmm. Flavor follows with sweet pineapple notes, honey, but plenty of bitterness to balance the rich creaminess of the sweet tropical fruit: mango, pineapple, and some citrus peel. Creamy body, medium to medium low carbonation. This is good.

16 oz. can thanks to Willrunforbeer in a recent trade. Aroma is what I look for in a DIPA. Light tropical fruit, light dank weed, light scallions. 
Body has a nice sweet malt body to balance the huge hop character. Candied mango, juicy grapefruit and a mild lingering dank grass note. Bitterness is large but not completely overwhelming like some other lesser DIPAs can do. No palate fatigue with this bad boy. Bold yet a level of smoothness. Mild citrus rind with some fresher cut grassy note after the sip. Damn, Bissell is killing it with these recipes lately. Looks like another trip to Portland is in order soon. Finely crafted.
Can shared by John, thanks. Pours pale white gold with a white head. Aroma is dank, grapefruit. Flavor is fruity, heavy on the grapefruit, some peach. Grapefruit peel finish.

Holy god, this is amazing. Can pours hazy gold, eggshell white head. Massive pineapple, tropical fruit. Sweet malt bill. Mango, orange juice, peach. A little sweet, but thats a trivial knock. Outstanding.
Pours a hazy pale orange with a white lacing. The aroma is citrus, orange, grapefruit, nelson esc, followed by grass and pine.
